posts.post_content:
@ratchet1215  
If you're at 3 life, and you're opponent's at 6 with 2 creatures, doesn't it make it pointless for Serra to attack anyway? Not only do you risk her dying, but even if her attack goes through, landing your opponent with 2 life, isn't it pointless even if she blocks? One creature would still get through. If you want to bring [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) or  [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Terminate) into the picture, isn't it the same for Serra? They are, after all, instants. With [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel), if you attack, you gain 5 life. If you block, you gain 5 life. (Lifelink) Doesn't it make sense to NOT attack with Baneslayer on your turn and just block when your opponent attacks, possibly killing one of the creatures, and gaining 5 life in the process? Baneslayer also has protection from Demons and Dragons, which comes in very helpful against bigger flyers such as [Xathrid Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Xathrid Demon). There's a reason why Serra's an Uncommon while Baneslayer's a Mythi... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: LordTaco (8/17/2009 3:53:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card hasn't been made obsolete by Miss [Baneslayer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer), for two reasons: One, you will have a heart attack of joy whether you pull Baneslayer or Serra in Limited, where either one will dominate; Two, Vigilance is and always has been an imperative factor in Serra Angel's power level, allowing her to put your opponent on a clock without sacrificing your own defensive force. If you're at 3 life and your opponent's at 6 with two creatures, don't tell me you'd rather have a Baneslayer who taps when she attacks, doesn't force your opponent to act (since you'll die next turn if you attack with no tricks), and gives him plenty of time to pull a [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) or [Terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terminate).
posts.html:
This card hasn't been made obsolete by Miss Baneslayer, for two reasons: One, you will have a heart attack of joy whether you pull Baneslayer or Serra in Limited, where either one will dominate; Two, Vigilance is and always has been an imperative factor in Serra Angel's power level, allowing her to put your opponent on a clock without sacrificing your own defensive force. If you're at 3 life and your opponent's at 6 with two creatures, don't tell me you'd rather have a Baneslayer who taps when she attacks, doesn't force your opponent to act (since you'll die next turn if you attack with no tricks), and gives him plenty of time to pull a Doom Blade or Terminate.

posts.post_content: @Bauble: It's not Serra Angel that has a measly ability, it's [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) that is completely unbalanced. Serra Angel has always been the measuring stick to which big white creatures have been designed, and the newer [Shepherd of the Lost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shepherd of the Lost), a totally underrated card, is an example of how a balanced white angel should look. I agree with ratchet1215 in that having a Serra out still has its uses, even at 5cmc, though I would also say that having a Baneslayer out would mean just about the same thing, and probably better in most cases.
posts.html:
@Bauble: It's not Serra Angel that has a measly ability, it's Baneslayer Angel that is completely unbalanced. Serra Angel has always been the measuring stick to which big white creatures have been designed, and the newer Shepherd of the Lost, a totally underrated card, is an example of how a balanced white angel should look. I agree with ratchet1215 in that having a Serra out still has its uses, even at 5cmc, though I would also say that having a Baneslayer out would mean just about the same thing, and probably better in most cases.

posts.post_content:
ok, so there is a lot of comparison between this and baneslayer, so lets look at them side by side  
  
Serra: 5 cmc, 3WW 4/4, flying, vigilance  
  
Baneslayer: 5 cmc, 3WW, 5/5, lifelink, flying, first strike, prot dragons and demons  
  
and because it won me a game today, I am gonna include it, it is after all a decent contender  
  
Shepard of the lost: 5 cmc, 4W, 3/3, flying, first strike, vigilance  
  
so lets check mana cost; shepard is slightly less white needy, but all cost 5  
power/toughness; Baneslayer is obviously most powerful at 5/5, and shepard is weakest at 3/3, falling to lightning bolt  
abilities: all have flying, bane and shepard have FS, serra and shepard have vigilance, bane has lifelink and prot from demon and dragon  
  
alright, so far baneslayer is superior, a 5/5 liflinker is always gonna win out, especially with FS, but none of these guys can stop a doomblade, I think doomblade even pictures baneslayer's death, and serra and shepard have vigilance, and shepard also has FS  
  
shepard is... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
